reviewTitle: VR Is Not Just For Kids.  Everyone Should Have One of These!
reviewDescription: I’m truly amazed at how awesome this Occulus Quest 2 refurbished headset is.  It’s the same as the Meta Quest 2, but it has the old logo on it.  It’s also discounted about $50, which is why I decided to finally try VR.  I don’t know why I waited so long!  Oh, I know, most of us probably think VR is just for kids, or we don’t like shooting games, or we get motion sick and all that jumping around would be too much for us.  I know, that as someone who’s considered, well elderly, I should just stay away from this nonsense and leave it to grandkids, right?  That is so wrong!  Sure, there’s a lot of violent shooting games available and you could easily make yourself sick riding roller coasters in VR, and there’s a lot of potential for people to abuse community spaces and bully others, but that’s just a tiny portion of what VR opens up to you when you put on a Quest 2 headset.  I’m the first to admit, I had my reservations, but although I’m old, and disabled to boot, I don’t think you ever get too old to try something new, especially something like this that lets you experience things that you’ve never experienced, without having to leave the comfort of your home.  You don’t have to climb mountains in VR, but with this headset you can if you want to.  You can come pretty close to the experience without actually plummeting towards the earth when you jump and miss your handholds.  The view are spectacular in that particular game, but I had to return it because although it says you can play it sitting, I couldn’t really do it from a wheelchair.  That’s not a problem, though, because if you purchase most games or apps you have the option to return it within 14 days, providing you haven’t spent over a certain amount of time using it.  But there’s plenty that even someone as limited in physical ability as I am can enjoy in VR, thanks to this fully self contained headset.  With the Quest 2, you don’t need to be tethered to an expensive gaming computer, and there are things that anyone can find in VR that will amaze and astonish even the most unflappable person.  Right now, there are a wide variety of games and apps, some free, that no matter your age or interests, you will be able to find things that make you say, “Wow!”.  You can get an app that allows you to go anywhere in the world, similar to using Google Earth, except that you find yourself being able to look around as if you were there at a famous landmark or your childhood home.  You can take guided tours to places you probably didn’t know existed, or take a tour of the Space Station and see how the astronauts live and work there, go swimming with whales or watch gorillas play in a jungle.  You can meditate, play musical instruments, meet people with similar interests, take courses, draw and paint in 2D and 3D, play golf or dance, surf the internet, or one of my favorite things so far, sit in a movie theater and get the feeling of truly watching a movie on a big screen while actually being comfortable at home.  I know that sounds unusual, but for someone like me who hasn’t been able to go to a movie theater in many years, it’s a truly awesome experience.  I haven’t had my Quest 2 long enough yet, to convince friends and family to join me in VR, but if they do, we can watch movies or play games together in a variety of settings.  For me, the neatest game I’ve discovered yet is VR Fishing!  It’s so relaxing to fish in real places in Japan, South Korea, or the Northwestern USA, in a variety of weather conditions, from shore or in boats, and to catch fish and put them in your Aquarium in your fish lodge.  It’s a nearly magical experience to feel as if you are truly getting a nibble to catching a fish that looks so real that you can forget for a moment that you’re at home, and you feel like you’re actually sitting in a wooden boat in the rain and mist at a lake in the mountains.  VR is awesome for everyone, but especially if you or someone you know loves to travel or fish, or do any number of things but you find yourself unable to enjoy such activities anymore due to physical limitations or even monetary restrictions.  VR is a great way to expand possibilities beyond what’s easily available.  If I were younger and healthier, my dream job would be to bring VR to as many people as possible, but especially to elderly and home bound or disabled folks whose lives are getting narrower and restricted.  VR can expand your environment in ways that have never been possible before.  Quest 2 is relatively affordable, easy to use, and it will only get better as more people expand their lives into the VR environment.  I was surprised at how easy it was get started, and I was able to do most of it right from within VR.  Is it perfect?  Absolutely not. It’s a bit of a money pit.  When you buy the Quest 2, you get a headset, two controllers, and a charger cord.  That’s all.  The controllers are battery powered.  If you want rechargeable controllers, you’ll likely need a charger base with rechargeable batteries.  You’ll almost certainly have to get a head strap because the one that comes with the Quest 2 headset is minimal and it feels like the headset is going to fall off no matter how much you tighten it when you put it on.  If you want to balance it better and give you more playtime, you’ll need a head strap with a battery.  Unless you invest in a charging station, you’ll probably want a case, and lens covers because you can’t allow sunlight to hit the the lenses because that could burn out headset.  There are other helpful accessories, such as controller covers, lens cloths and covers, possibly a fan to keep your glasses from fogging if you wear glasses, or you can buy prescription lenses here on Amazon, or other accessories.  Some are more necessary than others, and depending of what you use your headset for, you may not need every possible accessory.  At this moment, as fun as VR is, it’s still in it’s infancy, but it’s usefulness to others besides video gamers is growing every day.  Meta Quest 2 is probably the most useful and affordable stand alone VR system available, and there’s plenty to be found in it.  I’ve barely scratched the surface of what it’s capable of doing, and I think that even old folks like me, who might be initially reluctant to try it, can find plenty of awesome things to do if we can be persuaded to try it out.  I’m kicking myself that I didn’t buy one the first time I saw it, because it would have made my pandemic isolation a lot less isolating.  I wish that something like this would have been available when my dad was confined to bed and a wheelchair after his stroke many years ago, because he loved to travel and learn new things, and VR opens up the world to exploration without even leaving home.  With the Quest 2, exploration is easy and fun.  If you’re thinking of trying it out, for yourself or a gift for someone young or old or in between, there’s never been a better time or a better and more affordable device than the Meta Quest 2. [Edit] [Addition] I recently got new glasses, and while it comes with a spacer for glasses, I was using it without glasses because since I had cataract surgery and I thought my vision was good enough without wearing glasses.  Although my distance correction was minimal, nearly the smallest size available, I got a great Black Friday deal on prescription lenses that snap right on to the regular lenses.  This turned out to be one of the best accessories I've bought for my Quest 2.  I highly recommend getting these, as long as your distance correction is a negative number.  I hadn't realized how much I was settling for by not wearing my glasses because I found it uncomfortable.  Now my vision is really crisp, and if someone else wants to try my headset, the lenses snap right off so they don't have to look through my prescription.  I'm still enjoying my headset nearly every day.  It's even got Amazon Prime Video available to watch on a big screen, which is a favorite of mine as I'm a Prime member.

I first want to start off by saying not only do I love the product but I'm really impressed by the seller. I was really worried about buying this refurbished because I didn't know what to expect, however if I wasn't the one who paid for it and saw "refurbished" I would have thought it was brand new. It came In a sealed box, with all the plastic coverings, stickers to remove, everything, just like a new one.I did purchase this for my son, who is only 12. I was a little worried about the people he could interact with but I was very happy to see that there are settings where you can set it for children to use, there are setting to approve if he can interact with strangers or not as well. Lastly, the most reassuring thing, you can download the app, allowing you to view and hear everything that is being done in the Oculus, from your phone, allowing you to see/hear what they are doing.I also really appreciate the fact that even though the transaction was marked 3 days in a row by my card company, not allowing the transaction to go through until day 4, my transaction wasn't cancelled or sent to someone else.My son saved up for 6 months to buy this, he worked his ass off in school to get A's to get money and worked his ass off ay home to earn money from chores, I can confidently say, it was very much worth it. He's so happy with it, there are so many cool games and easy to find free ones.It's a great product over all and I can't express how amazing it was being refurbished, If you are on the fence about thispurchase, I sat go for it. It's so fun and worth it, it's fun for everyone in the house ranging from the kids to the adults. Highly recommend.

reviewTitle: Amazing product for it being renewed!
reviewDescription: I love my meta/occulus quest 2. Also, no need to have Facebook to play games! I initially didn't buy it because of that. Overall I give this a 9/10!About the console:Set up: Setting it up is quite easy. Depending on your wifi speed, it can take up to 15-30 minutes. You will need to make a meta account. I use my phone and linked it to my device. My device needed an update, so expect that, as well.Battery life: Impressive battery life. My oculus lasts up to two weeks (average 30 minutes play time daily). The controllers do need batteries after the ones included die out, but there's third party sellers who are using rechargeable batters and stations. I may invest in that. The charging takes up to two hours, at most.Controllers: They feel very comfortable to use. It feels natural to use compared to other VR consoles (PSVR1--btw, I am a Playstation fan, but the move controllers suck). For Nintendo lovers, they have ABYX buttons (I also love Nintendo).Graphics--They are pretty good for an entry level VR. I feel immersed playing. The colors are vibrant. Do not expect them to be super higher graphic like newer VRs (this did come out around 2020/2021). I'm sure the Meta quest 3 will have advanced graphics.Immersive--This is where I feel Meta's VRs take the cake, especially the Quest lineups. Wireless playing is soooooo much less of a hassle compared to using cords, and cables. I can also stand, jump, walk around, and feel like I'm part of the game. I can also sit and play some games when I feel lazy. In other words, I have a choice. This is where it really sold me with the Meta compared to my PSVR1 I used to own, and why I didn't buy a PSVR2. Also you can take it with you for others to play (will need to buy a travel case)! You also have a "home base" you can customize. From futuristic, to a secluded resort, to a Kyoto resort (this is mine currently), I found it very relaxing to do that. I also love the different avatar selections you can use and they have a wide range of diverse choices.Comfort--This is where I feel the meta does lose compared to the PS lineups and other lineups. I cannot play it more than 30 minutes without getting a headache. The solution is to buy an elite strap, but why not just make it comfortable to play with from the get go? This is where the minus one point comes from.Games--Now the fun. I'll be honest, Sony outdoes the quest with RPGs and shoot 'em ups, in my opinion, but the quest outdoes Sony with social and casual games. So, it depends on what you want out of a gaming experience.I hope this review helps someone out there thinking between a Quest vs PSVR, likes to compare the two, or is hesitant with the whole Facebook thing.

reviewTitle: BEST THING EVER!! SEEMS BRAND NEW!!!
reviewDescription: This Is So Awesome! I Should Have Gotten It Sooner! My Son Is 6 Years Old & Loves It & Is More Active! He Took Off The Headset Earlier & He Was Dripping Sweat! He Is Having So Much Fun, He Doesnt Even Notice How Much He Is Working Out At The Same Time. When It’s Cooler Outside He Stays Inside On His IPad. This Is A Great Alternative! Came In The Original Package, All Original Pieces & Accessories! Best Purchase. Only Bad Thing Is, The Lack Of Games On It For A 6 Year Old. So I Have Had To Cave In On Some Gory Ones. Hopefully More Games To Come!

I was impressed from the moment I put it on. The VR experience is immersive enough that a rock climbing game greatly reduced my acrophobia.I'm in my mid-40s and was a computer geek from age 7 but I haven't cared to play games for 10 years. I bought this on a whim, half-expecting to return it out of lack of interest. Instead, I get countless hours of entertainment out of this thing each week, and I've mostly only used it for games, so far. You can watch 3D movies and documentaries, use all kinds of productivity apps, enjoy endless travel videos, witness celestial events and anything else you can think of. Most services like YouTube and Netflix have an app for the Quest, and those that don't can still be accessed through the web browser.The Quest has an app store with free and paid content. Additionally, you can access free VR games through websites in the browser. You can also link the Quest to your PC to play some of your computer games in VR, and you can access quality VR games through your PC via services like Steam.I recommend this for lovers of non-physical games of any type, including card and board games. And it's worth considering the Quest+ subscription. For $5/mo you get a bunch of premium games that would otherwise cost hundreds, with new ones rotated in each month.I think people with mobility problems could see a real quality-of-life improvement from this machine. With the built-in microphone, lonely kids will benefit more from this device than from other multiplayer game systems where communication is not verbal and auditory.

Okay, weird title, right? Hear me out.One of my kids gets a lot of movement being in taekwondo and playing outside. However, two of my kids were starting to scare me with how little they moved in non-school hoursThis is awesome. They play Gorilla Tag and some wizard game and they move around, flinging their arms around, and they play so hard they end up all sweaty.Would it be better for them to get outside and play out there? Definitely. But sometimes I'll take what I can get when I don't feel like arguing the point.

This is my first experience with modern VR after the disappointing attempt back in the '90s. For me the Quest 2 was the right balance of cost vs quality. I am a lifelong PC gamer and this exceeded my expectations as a standalone unit and even more so as a PCVR device. Out of the box the experience was better than expected but, If you do your research and learn how to use the settings I would find it difficult for most players to be disappointed. Even quite a few of the standalone apps have impressed me. This is highly recommended for any first time VR enthusiasts who didn't want a huge first time investment. Plus the Amazon premium renewed is worth it for the year return.

reviewTitle: Picture isn't as sharp as I would like.
reviewDescription: This is my first VR Headset. It's amazing to see how far tech has come. It's such an awesome experience, I'm contemplating getting the Apple Vision Pro. The controller technology is amazing. It will impress you. I did find that the resolution and in the image isn't as crisp and sharp as I would like it to be. But that doesn't deter me from using it. It's a very fun device. If you've never played VR, games with a lot of movement will cause nausea...keep this in mind. The store has a decent variety of games but they can be pricey and some games require a subscription...keep this in mind too. Overall, I do recommend this product!On an added note: This is my second purchase as Amazon Renewed and I must say that it has been a two out of two excellent experience. The product was packaged just like it was new. It even had the plastic linings that a product from the manufacturer would have. It had absolutely no signs of use or blemishes and It has worked flawlessly.

Where do I start with this VR system it is so great I love how it makes everything so 3D! When you look inside of it it looks so real! The handles are easy to control in the headset fits your face really well as long as you had just the straps! You will sweat though a little bit after you wear it for a while so don't wear it for too long. I do wish that it fit better on kids heads because the first we put on our kid it fell down and cracked because her head was too small. So maybe they could Implement some smaller straps for children to make it kind of more Universal that would be great you can't see on the outside which works well. I wish it would have came in a different color as well White straps seems to get dirty I would have did a gray or a navy blue or black in color also I would have wished they had more storage for the price. The price could have been a lot more cheaper and affordable for everyone!

reviewTitle: This appears to be completely new... except for
reviewDescription: …a few small coffee or tea stains that was easily wiped off. I noticed no residual greasy or dirty film on the headset itself. It appeared completely new and all the protective labels and protective wrapping were still on it. The silicone and foam appeared as new also, while the silicone face ring was still in the original paper sleeve.The headset arrived with about 45% state of charge, I set up as new and installed Gravity sketch for work and did all the usual FB login stuff and it was working within minutes. After I was done with the setup, I charged it fully and the battery did get to a full 100%, even though it was noted that these were at least able to hold 90% charge from new. The entire box arrived as a new one would, but the tape seals did indicate that the item was refurbished.I’ve added some anti-slip hexes and cat tongue tape in the photos, as these are the only photos I have of the unit. The addition of these helped grip so much, there’s less fatigue for extended sessions from gripping the hand units too tightly or fear of them slipping out of your hands. I’m not a fan of the silicone sleeves or socks that add too much thickness, and even weight, especially when used in 3D sketching and modeling, where slower and more precise movement is required.Totally worth it if you get a good one and the full warranty and packaging are "as-new".  Saved myself $50 for a tool that's needed for work while I return the one I've been borrowing for Gravity sketch training for auto design modeling.  BTW, Gravity sketch is an amazing tool that's quite powerful.. The games and apps available are amazing as well.. very excited to try out the other capabilities and apps with this Quest 2!

reviewTitle: A Good Standalone VR Headset but Not Great for PC Use
reviewDescription: This was my first time using VR since the first gen Oculus Rift, and while this headset has massively improved in terms of optics, screen quality, sensors, and more, the PC experience got worse. However, before I get to that, I do want to say that this renewed unit was virtually brand new. It came in the original box, and all the accessories had brand new packaging around them. Even the headset itself appeared as new, without any scuffs, scratches, hair, dust or anything of the like.The setup was very easy to do and only took a few minutes, although I did have to get some assistance from online help on Meta as the Touch controllers would not initially pair to the headset. The headset is very easy to put on as it features an easy to adjust fabric strap, an optional silicone liner, a glasses attachment for those with glasses, and a three-way IPD adjustment. Once done with the setup, the Meta Quest storefront offers a lot of apps, but I found that it lacked a significant amount compared to when I had the Oculus Rift years ago for my PC. This could be due to the limitations of the Quest 2 when used standalone, so I didn't initially think much about this.Now, in terms of the quality of the headset, the lenses are way better than anything I was used to previously. The screen door effect was almost entirely gone, and the inner display was able to deliver a brighter image with better color reproduction. The only thing that hindered it was that, despite having much sharper and clearer optics, the actual resolution of the games did not look that great when using it on its own. So, to me, it was like seeing super clear but very bland graphics with a lack of detail. When using it with my PC, this was a different story as the games I was able to run looked way clearer and more detailed than anything from the standalone mode and I was impressed, at first. The audio was also impressive. The audio comes out of built-in speakers in the straps and they do an excellent job at delivering high grade surround sound audio with surprisingly very little noise bleed. Even at max volume, others in the room around me could only barely notice the audio coming from the headset.I also loved how great the cameras on the headset were able to track my movements as it really did feel immersive when using the headset on its own. The touch controllers are fluid and responsive, and most games feel like you are actually there and interacting with your surroundings for real. Additionally, the guardian system does a great job at creating artificial boundaries that you can see in-game that prevent you from ever worrying about running into your surroundings.However, when using the headset in Standalone mode, the built-in battery drains FAST, like extremely fast. On a full charge I was lucky to play games for about 2 hours before it needed to be plugged-in, and that was only on most games. More intense games like Beatsaber, that number would drop to around 1 hour 30 minutes of playtime per charge. Once again, this isn't an issue when using it with a PC as the Link cables can maintain and charge the battery while you are using it.Now, let's get to my main problem; PC Gaming. While I initially loved the concept of using this as a standalone headset with the option of connecting it to my PC, I found that this created an absolute mess compared to the older Rift. The setup was very tedious in the Oculus app to start as it initially kept saying my Quest Link cables were USB 2 and not delivering the required bandwidth. I tried many different cables, even the official Meta Quest Link cable, and it just did not work. I eventually found out that this was an error due to me using a 7900 XT GPU which was not officially listed on the list of supported graphics cards. I then tried setting it up on my backup gaming rig with an older 6600 XT GPU and it worked perfectly there. From this point I used the backup PC to set up the PC side of things, and all seemed well- until SteamVR got involved. Personally, I own way more VR games on Steam than I do on the Oculus store, so I followed the steps to get SteamVR working to play those games. At first, it all ran smoothly until it didn't. While I was able to get SteamVR working on the Quest, it only detected some of the games I had and not all of them- which was a lot that was missing. For the games that were missing from the SteamVR dashboard, I would then have to add a shortcut to my desktop and then use the "desktop" mirroring ability in the Quest to view my desktop in the headset and then use the controllers to manually open the game from the Desktop. However, this only worked some of the time and not all of the time as sometimes either the Desktop preview would freeze or lose signal, or the games wouldn't open at all, or the game would open on my PC but not open inside the headset.Overall, this is a very capable headset, but since I can't use it well with my PC which is what I primarily got it for, and due to its subpar battery life in standalone mode, I had no choice to return it. While I am impressed at the brand new-like quality of the headset I received, I honestly cannot recommend this headset for PC use (unless you ONLY use the Oculus store and NOT SteamVR). For everything else, it's okay, but it's just not for me. Hopefully the next gen Quest headset can improve this.
I like the meta 2 for what it is but my controller has been experiencing a significant amount of drift and it’s getting frustrating

reviewTitle: Fun and Exciting, but Not Without Its Flaws
reviewDescription: So, I recently got my hands on the Meta Quest 2, and I have to say, it's a pretty cool piece of tech. It's a fun and exciting way to experience virtual reality, but it's not without its flaws.On the positive side, the Meta Quest 2 is a blast to use. The graphics are crisp and clear, and the tracking is spot-on. It's also very easy to set up and use, which makes it a great option for both experienced and novice gamers.Another great feature of the Meta Quest 2 is the variety of games and experiences available. There's something for everyone, from action-packed shooters to calming meditation apps.However, there are some drawbacks to the Meta Quest 2. Firstly, the battery life is not very impressive, and it tends to drain quickly. This can be a major issue, especially for those who want to use it for extended periods of time.Additionally, the device can be quite heavy and uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time. This can be a major issue for those who want to use it for extended gaming sessions or experiences.Moreover, the price of the Meta Quest 2 is also a major drawback. It's quite expensive, and the additional costs for games and accessories can add up quickly.Overall, while the Meta Quest 2 is a fun and exciting way to experience virtual reality, it's not without its flaws. The battery life, weight, and price can all be major drawbacks for some users. However, if you're willing to overlook these issues, the Meta Quest 2 can provide you with hours of entertainment and excitement.

reviewTitle: Hardware is great. Software meh. Games are great.
reviewDescription: It’s astonishing that Facebook is a user experience company and they just flopped so hard on the software design (while nailing the hardware, which, to be fair, they purchased). The quest 2 has multi user setup, but one person has to be the admin, and that person can share certain games with shared users, but other accounts can’t. What. Also, only the admin can stream (to a tv, to the internet, to the app).So if I’m the admin and my gf adds an account, I can share beat saber with her, but she can’t share it with me. I can play on my account and stream to the tv, but if she wants to play on hers (to keep her scores separate), she can’t stream because she’s not an admin. And as an admin, I can’t tell it to stream her view because it’s not my account.If you buy this to play with your child, you can’t watch what they’re doing (to enjoy with them, to monitor their online interactions, or even to troubleshoot). They have to play on your account… so why even have separate accounts…?Some of the dumbest decisions I’ve ever seen in software. My god.However, the hardware is amazing and even has a no controller mode where it maps your hand movements via front camera. The games are arcade style fun, with lots of dancing, swinging swords, punching the air, and shooting games. The frame rate is high enough that I don’t feel sick even when the scene is moving very fast. Really solid experience outside of facebook’s OS.

When I had first bought the headset I had a lot of fun on the games I had but later on I found there is not much replay ability to any of the games. It was fun for the first few days but it seemed more like a chore after a while. There is not a lot of games with just the base headset. I would only recommend getting it if you have a PC to get other games not available on the oculus store.

I had this oculus quest 2 for about a month. The first experience as a newcomer was kind of neat and enticing. However, this all changed when you sit down and see that the actual quality of the strap is horrible and the lenses eye levels all hard to adjust. To add on, the screen pixels are noticeable and will probably give you some motion sickness. At this point just get the new improve version, since apparently is so much better. Battery life also was MEH, and PCVR function as intended, Air link also but that all depends on your WIFI connection

So far, pretty cool, however, these really don’t work well with my glasses. No matter how much I adjust, there’s always some part of the view in each eye that is blurry. I’ve tried with two different pairs of glasses. A different type of strap might help or I might have to order the specialty prescription lens inserts. Not sure yet.Also, I’m sure not everyone will have this issue, but I got really really nauseous after using it the other day. Almost to the point of throwing up. I might need to just try some nausea medicine or something but if I can’t find something to help with the nausea and the glasses issue, I might end up returning the headset.

reviewTitle: Not bad, but could use work
reviewDescription: While this is a Meta device, there are some hoops to jump through to get it connected to your desktop and Stream. Once tackled, everything is pretty straight forward. Ultimately, it is an amazing experience degraded slightly by discomfort.The head strap is terrible. Replace it with another (I picked up the Kiwi Designs one here on Amazon). Most of the pain is now gone, except for the eye strain.I waffled between 3 and 4 stars on this. There's no seemingly breakthrough apps beyond a handful of great games to be had. There's a definite awe-factor when playing Elite Dangerous or No Man's Sky in VR.  Using Desktop mode in the Oculus gives you a giant version of your PC desktop - but given the eye-strain, I'd rather just use my physical monitor.Overall - if you're a gamer, there's plenty of things to try with the two aforementioned games being pretty good things to pick up on sale. For the broadest consumer appeal, this is going to take a few more generations to hit the sweet spot for pain-free performance and utility

There's a lot to say about VR in general and this product in particular.I would recommend everyone that is not familiar with VR to study the potential downsides carefully. In particular it can give you nausea, which varies from person to person and can be overcome by some people and not by others. The experience itself can be amazing. On the other hand, I'm finding I don't use it as much as I hoped (and I have previous version of a VR headset) because the apps are very limited. I probably wouldn't buy it again for that reason alone, though of course that's not a criticism of the headset itself. Look it up before getting into it if this is new to you.The product itself is good. I have had no problems with it, once I got it set up, which can be a little tricky. I use it mostly plugged into my gaming computer, which gives a better experience compared to using it on its own. To do that you need a very powerful (and expensive) PC. That's not to say that the unplugged experience is not acceptable. It is. Value for money is excellent compared to other offerings.

This is my first VR headset, so I don’t have anything to compare it to. Thus far I’ve been very impressed with the capabilities of the unit, especially for the relatively low price point. As a self-contained unit, it’s actually nice not to have to worry about connecting to a phone or anything like that.  The game selection is pretty good, and the head and hand tracking do a great job in providing an immersive experience. The one drawback I have noticed is the adjustments for the display are limited. Essentially the only adjustments you can make are how far apart the eye pieces are. I would like to see more adjustments that would allow more fine-grained control of the picture quality.I would definitely recommend this if you’re interested in experiencing VR, as the system is very easy to use and approachable for a first time user, but provides the feature she would expect for heavy duty VR gaming and other applications.

reviewTitle: Was Decent, But Went Another Way
reviewDescription: I already had an HTC Vive which was getting a bit dated, so I thought I'd try an Oculus. I really didn't think it through. I didn't fully realize that Oculus was going to leverage Facebook for accounts. Because of past experiences, I don't trust Facebook enough to give it a credit card and didn't really want Facebook integration with annoyances like Messenger. I also got tangled up in trying to get the Oculus to use Steam. (It and the Vive would fight.) The newer Oculus was wireless and had better graphics, but I still liked my old Vive better, mostly because it doesn't integrate with Facebook and because it was easier to leverage Steam. I think I'll let the VR industry mature a little more before my next purchase.I bought the Oculus directly from their site, not via Amazon. This proved to be handy as there's a 30-day trial period and you can get a full refund. That might be handy for folks who aren't sure if VR is something they want.

reviewTitle: Awesome Renewal, like new! Big firmware issues though.
reviewDescription: After facebook bumped the prices of this headset up by $100, I thought id rather buy a refurbished one. This product came with all the original packaging, and if you had told me it was brand new I would completely believe you. In that regard, it is fantastic!HOWEVER, when I set up the headset- it would NOT connect to the controllers or my phone. It took me about an hour to figure out that the firmware the headset came with was no longer supported by oculus.For anyone interested, this issue can be resolved by finding the firmware online, and manually sideloading it, but you do need some technical know how. Not everyone wants to do that.I can only hope this issue is resolved on amazons end before this same issue occurs underneath someones christmas tree, or if it happens to someone who doesnt know how to fix it.

We purchased two of these. They were delivered on July 19. A few weeks later, two small bright dots appeared on the left side of the screen (at about the 11:00 position) in one of the headsets. The internet said they were frozen pixels and suggested a factory reset, which we did. It did not fix the problem, so we contacted customer service. We were shocked to learn that after only a few weeks of use, they would not replace the faulty headset. They gave us only one option: a refund - but ONLY if we returned BOTH headsets. We paid about $250 per headset, and the refurbished ones are now selling for $350 each. So basically, we could send these back, pay an additional $200 and have absolutely no recourse if the replacements also failed to work. We asked to speak with a supervisor and were told we would receive a call in 24 hours.  We never received a call. Because we LOVE the one that works and it would be a financial hardship to invest another $200 on the chance that the replacements might be reliable, we decided to keep the originals. We have never experienced such poor customer service from Amazon.

That or you literally tether yourself with the USB 3.2 link cable to your PC. Which in my opinion was far less than ideal or comfortable to do.I hope in the next 5-7 years these things can become priced reasonably & actually give a worthwhile user experience.

reviewTitle: Renewed Unit 1 - No Power / Unit 2 - Blurred Lenses
reviewDescription: My son purchased a Meta Quest 2 (MQ-2) a couple of weeks prior to me ordering this one.  He wasn't willing to share for more than 5 to 10 minutes, so I thought I would get one for the rest of the family.  We were all excited when it arrived.  It arrived perfectly packaged, and although it was a renewed item, every component looked new.  Unfortunately, that's where the good vibes ended.I carefully extracted the unit and pressed the power button and absolutely nothing happened.  So I held it in for a few seconds, and still nothing happened.  I made several more attempts, but I didn't even see a glimmer of light from the lens nor the power indicator light on the outer case.  Obviously the battery must have been dead.  So I charged it for several hours and tried again.  It still wouldn't work.  I didn't want to do this, but I had to go to my son to ask for help.  I just knew he would figure out how to power it on and then tell me I was out of touch with modern electronics, but to my surprise, he couldn't get it to power on either.  We left it on the charger overnight and tried again the next morning, but it still would not power on.I called Amazon and asked for a return and replacement.  I couldn't be happier with their return service. Two days later I received another renewed MQ-2.  Unfortunately, I had to return it also.  The lenses were extremely blurry.  The focus adjustments incorporated in the unit did nothing to improve the issue.  After comparing the same games and scenery from my MQ-2 to my son's MQ-2.  I knew the lenses in my unit were defective.I'm not a quitter; so I didn't give up, but I decided to refrain from ordering another renewed MQ-2.  The third and hopefully final MQ-2 was purchased as a brand new unit.  I'll write a review for the new MQ-2 also, but I'll summarize that future review by saying the view through it is much better than the view through my second renewed unit.  If you choose a renewed MQ-2, just remember that someone returned it for a reason, and that reason might be because it was defective.  I know these units are certified by Oculus to work and look like-new, but in my case, I received two duds.

Meta Quest 2 has some issues. We fell in love with it and spent about 18 hours trying to fix a glitch with not seeing the controllers in the head set and not being able to click on anything. I researched took out batteries for 15 min multiple times, booted, factory reset, cleared App Cache, cleared guardian, synced controllers to headset multiple times and the controllers still vibrate and blink. Ugh! Had to return and ordered meta 3. I hope it works better.

reviewTitle: Received Completely Dead + Power Button Malfunction
reviewDescription: I was VERY disappointed to find out when I got my oculus that was it completely dead, and so I had to charge it, but honestly I didn’t find it that as big of a deal.. at least, compared to the other issue I found out later on. After I let the Oculus charge and it showed a green light, of course I tried to turn it on.Well.. nothing that you would expect to happen, happened when I tried to do so. The only thing that would occur is when I plugged and unplugged the charger from the headset, I would see the Oculus symbol, then a battery icon showing how charged the Oculus was ..then it would disappear and nothing. I even tried to reset it, factory reset it, but nothing ever popped up and the button on the side never glowed white, either.After thinking for a while and talking to some friends who have a perfectly working Oculus themselves, we all came to the conclusion that the issue has to be with the power button. Think about it, it charged perfectly fine and even the controllers seemed to work, just the headset itself would not power on at all.. or doing anything related to needing to press the power button. So unfortunately, I had to return my headset.. which REALLY bummed me out. I truly was looking forward to playing VR with my friends and significant other.. Hopefully nobody else has to have the same experience as myself, it just makes me so upset that’s something worth over $300+ had this kind of experience.

reviewTitle: Defective?? Right out of the box...
reviewDescription: I opened up the box minutes after being delivered. The headset was defective right out of the box, stating this error:"The cooling fan on your device is not functioning properly. Your headset may overheat or experience abnormal behavior due to insufficient cooling"I couldn't believe what I was seeing. Before buying this, I spent lots of time looking through various reviews of this refurbished headset, and knew I would be taking some kind of risk. But to get an error straight after taking it out of the box? Really??I hoped the error was a false positive. So I tested it out by wearing the headset for 15-20 minutes. I watched the introductory videos and tried to find a way to comfortably put on the headset. When I got to the part of setup that required the headset to download firmware updates, the headset was already uncomfortably hot. I took it off and listened anywhere for a fan noise, but nothing. I restarted the headset a few times, let it charge, but no - The error kept popping up over and over after each restart.DO NOT buy this refurbished version. What happened to me may not happen to the majority of buyers... But a deal-breaking, easily detectable defect right out of the box?! The description claims that these headsets are "guaranteed to look and function like new", but this is a complete lie. Don't risk it, spend the extra $50 or whatever it might be and get the fresh one. That's what I've been left to do after waiting for the refund to process.

You can't set up the headset without setting up your profile in the app;the app will not let me past the "Choose how you'll appear" screen.You can choose a screen name, but it won't advance to the next setting.Tried repeatedly setting it up with an email and with Instagram, reloading the app, resetting my phone, etc.The headset only gets to the point of telling you that you need to set it up with the mobile app,so the website is of no use.Meta support said they are aware of the issue: "our engineering team is aware of and are currently working on to resolve as soon as possible. Once I receive any update from the engineering team about when this may be resolved, I will let you know so that you can enjoy the VR experience as soon as possible."It has been four days. Now the app won't even allow for keyboard input to enter an email or password.Tried reloading, resetting, etc.I worked with multiple Oculus Go headsets in the past, and recently set up several of them with a new Meta account using just an email address, not a Facebook or Instagram account.Looking forward to using the Quest 2 if Meta ever resolves this issue, but I will be returning the headset if I can't even get to the point of setting it up.

My daughter forgot to put the charging cable in and I still have yet to receive a return code for that so I'm sure I'll end up being charged for it, or when I finally do get one it will take another month to refund the money. reviewTitle: Have been trying to get a repair
reviewDescription: We bought the oculus quest 2 to play with friends, we went to learn to set up with friends and played for a whole weekend, came home got busy with life and stored it when we tried to play with it again it would not charge and boot up, trying to get it to work and no Human Resources made us feel money out the window. A friend told us about the manufacture change and we reached out, what a joke, so I am reaching out to Amazon, we paid a lot of money for this and my daughters really love it, we bought another to replace it at Walmart but not the same. Please help

Waited for software development.  Can't  describe how wowed I am.  The software by 3rd parties is excellent.  Be prepared to spend an additional $100 to $200 on apps.  Most are reasonably priced from $10 to $20.This is a far cry above the cellphone VR goggles.  Plus the apps will mostly store on your Meta Quest.All the apps have trailers or demos and some have returns and yearly fees outside the demos.Can't say enough about how real the Meta Quest is.  Best example is imagine stepping into your TV set and becoming part of the show!

This machine is high preforming and just like new! Battery life is fine, you can play high performance games for up to hours while less consuming games might last another hour. Camera is great and I loved this product!

reviewTitle: VR is the new real technology
reviewDescription: As a baby boomer, this thing blew my MIND.  The default app looks like your in Veil ski resort.  Starry sky,  huge lodge with gazebo, decorative flame fountains, GIANT windmill, and you can almost catch the snowflakes!  I just did the intro lesson and i am retarded at throwing anything from balls to blocks to paper planes, but launching toy rockets from your hands is pretty simple.  Holding and releasing objects takes alot of practice. I bought the baseball app and i failed miserably on pitching and batting, but watching my "no lower body" teammates bob around is so funny.  I just bought the golf game and fortunately you can go to a VR driving range and practice!  Thant will be my first stop!!  Even you are not a seasoned gamer, just plan on lots of practice!  I am looking forward to the what i call the "skill games" that apply to real life,  like rock climbing and truck driving (I have an RV and its great for backing up practice).  As a doctor, I hope they make one that i can do major surgeries on!
It was for my grandson and he loves it.

My son loves this. Download the app to make set up easier. My tv doesn't support this device but I can mirror it from my phone so that I can watch him play. If you are going to be transporting this get a case! I also bought a backup battery and it extends playtime alot.
Great Virtual Reality headset.  My kids love it and it keeps them up and off the couch staying active.  Great purchase.

reviewTitle: Renewed is BETTER THAN NEW!! And Quest 2 is better than life itself!!!
reviewDescription: After reading review after review saying that Facebook was a nightmare to deal with for warranty service, (taking weeks and even months to respond), I noticed that Amazon Renewed has a one-year satisfaction guarantee (which seems to say the item doesn't even need to malfunction for you to return it), I realized Amazon Renewed was the way to go. If you add the 3-year warranty for just over $30, it still costs less than a direct-from-Facebook purchase which only has a one-year warranty, and most importantly, MY AMAZON RENEWED QUEST 2 ARRIVED IN WHAT LOOKED LIKE BRAND NEW CONDITION with only labels marked, "Refurbished" to clue me in that it was anything but new. I am an adult who is not into gaming, and I'm finding this device to be BEYOND AMAZING, transporting me to fantastic worlds that look and feel 100% real. In the few days that I've owned it, I've visited with elephants in Kenya (ECOSPHERE), ridden on a roller coaster with Santa (EPIC ROLLER COASTERS), danced with an alien (FIRST STEPS), relaxed in a breathtakingly modern home (ALCOVE), taken a bus tour of Dubai, attended a private performance by the most adorable girl dancing and singing in Japanese (TOUCH THE BEAT), learned the ins and outs of Quest 2 from a good-natured robot (FIRST CONTACT) and more -- and these were just the FREE apps! So all my research on warranties, guarantees and return policies likely won't matter since, it turns out my Quest 2 from Amazon Renewed is a keeper after all!!!!

reviewTitle: Truly looks and works as if brand new
reviewDescription: I got this for my child as a Christmas present to relpace the cheaper less cool version I got them a few years ago and ABSOLUTELY loved it.  Im considering getting myself one later this year so we can play together in the future.  I'm personally super pleased with how easit is so far to have the same type of parental controls security features like they have on mobile devices.  If you want your child that is 12 or younger to have this but are worried about them having access to things you don't want them to, this is the VR set I'd highly recommended

reviewTitle: I don’t like these companies trying to be futuristic and all that.
reviewDescription: I don’t have an issue with having a Facebook account to use it but I don’t like how you must use your phone to play any games on it. One day in October I factory reset my quest because it kept on asking me to input a code online. I hadn’t touched my quest 2 for a while. By a while I mean 4 weeks.Anyway when I tried to input the code through my computer. Expectedly, it bugged out and didn’t work every time I tried. So I factory reset the headset. I did every normal thing that you do when you turn on your quest for the first time. Until it asks you to connect it to your phone. It did not work, I even used a different phone. Nothing ever worked. And I never got it connected that day. I was thinking hard about selling it as junk  But I didn’t. In 2 days I decided to send it to a repair shop that fixes all kinds of electronics. They fixed it in about 2 days. The best part is they didn’t charge me because they “didn’t really fix anything”. And they were nice about it. Now I can use my quest whenever and nothing bad has happened since then. The quest 2 could’ve been better.

Honestly it's a cool vr set but if you expect to get your 30 dollar referral code don't bother with this one. Neither you nor your friend will get the money with this. The next day still no kick wouldn’t pair with the controllers we boxed it back up and returned. Paid the extra and ordered a brand new one

When I got it I was so disappointed though, first thing that happened was that I got the infamous Black Screen of death, and of course after trying everything I can possibly think of to no avail. So please refer to the title of this post cause I may have to do the same

Watched every youtube video I could find, bought cables that were recommended, but nothing.  I didn't download any Oculus games as the game I wanted to play is on steam only, so no comment there.  However, using PC with Steam was a NO GO, very frustrated.
Sound kept glitching and the right controller thumb button kept sticking.  I had no trouble returning it and went with a new one.
What an absolute PIA this thing is to set up. Nothing makes sense. And I'm a techy guy. It won't let me past wanting to download the app on my cell phone which has nothing to do with ANYTHING.

reviewTitle: It's seems like it's brand new
reviewDescription: It's super clean and no scratches or anything at all good packaging too.
Seems good, works snd I love that it has 256 memory
Plenty of free app options.

reviewTitle: vr works 100% legit such a steal for 256 gb

reviewDescription: Quality is immaculateShipped with careIt has become my favorite way to relax after work
It comes with everything you need to enjoy the oculus experience…satisfied customer.
What a ride!

No joke can not tell if this was used or not bought it refurbished premium and it has no signs of use from my point of viewOverall I don’t use it much I did love it at first but then it sad in a box for a while and now my little sisters are enjoying having a screen attached to their faces (what happened to sitting to close to the tv rots your brain)If you want to experience vr this is the best price to do so
Excellent!

This has been one of my better purchases from Amazon. I chose to purchase the renewed version because after reading lots of reviews, even some of the new devices have had issues. By purchasing the Quest 2 renewed I got a one year warranty vs just 30 days. When it arrived it was in brand new packaging. The stickers that sealed the box said it was renewed, but if they hadn't been on there I never would have guessed. I am extremely picky when it comes to buying electronics and I fully expected to find a problem or encounter an issue setting it up, but nothing. There isn't a mark on it that would suggest it had ever been used. Every piece in the box was labled, and packaged like new. Setting up the device was quick and easy. I was on the fence about getting one of these, but now I'm sorry I didn't get one sooner. The games are so much fun, one of my favorite being Walkabout Mini Golf. If you love mini golf and you don't own this game you are missing out. Also if you want to travel but can't afford to, the experiences on YouTube VR are awesome. The fitness apps are really great as well and so much fun. I highly recommend this purchase and I'm so glad I didn't buy new. With the money I saved buying renewed I was able to get a few much needed accessories. Thank you Amazon!**UPDATE **Our household has purchased 2 more of these with zero issues. They are so much fun, we love playing mini golf together.

reviewTitle: Remote controls didn’t connect after a week
reviewDescription: Gameplay is fantastic. Only thing was the remotes started to disconnect during gameplay and it will say “push any button to reconnect” I did that and it never connected. Great game experience though. I’m gonna get the meta quest 3.
Very nice but this took longer to receive.  It was put on the wrong truck per customer service.  And then received around 8 the day after it was supposed to be delivered.
I mainly got the Headset for Beat saber but was more then happy to try out other apps and games. None appealed to me so I returned it.

reviewTitle: Love the system, hate the issues
reviewDescription: I absolutely love the Occulus; I've owned two so far. I was excited to get this one for my birthday this year and decided to get the refurbished one. I have to be incredibly careful with it because it shuts off if I move to the left too fast or touch the left to readjust it and I am still having vibration problems with one of the controllers. Reaching out to customer support has not been helpful since I am only offered a discount on my next purchase so I have made peace that this is how it is going to be. I love the system, enjoy playing Beat Saber especially but I hate that I am having issues with no recourse to fix them.
I received the oculus and the day after I got it I finally got to turn it on and it popped up a message saying that the cooling fan isn’t operating correctly. So had to get a replacement.

Everything came fine but the left lens would flicker then get dimmer then shut completely off. I looked it up meta’s forums they say just factory reset it so I did and it still flicker other than that it came fine

Everything else came as advertised BUT the left hand controller does not let me press the left joystick which I am finding out is critical to play a bunch of games! In some games I cant even get past the instruction videos because of this malfunction. Very irritating.  The refund process is absolutely TERRIBLE bouncing between UPS and AMAZON.  I will never order a gaming system through Amazon again.
Everything was great it’s just the last driver didn’t listen to my instructions n took my package back but now they deliver it to me. I still need a refund on my fast shipping tho😬

reviewTitle: Just buy new. Refurb had issues.
reviewDescription: Within the first week we had an issue with the right controllers joystick. I contacted Amazon who directed me to go through Meta since it was under warranty. Long story short I have been unable to use this device for almost 30 days because I was required to send in the problem controller for them to replace it. They have had the controller for most of the month now and have yet to send a replacement. Horrible experience, and while the brunt of it is dealing with Meta (Oculus) warranty department…Amazon should have handled this part and just swapped either the whole system or the controller. Other than that it’s a great system, and I have no complaints. Just go ahead and spend the extra $ for new condition.

reviewTitle: Product came without being factory reset.
reviewDescription: For any new user out there, this would be a big issue. When you try to turn the device on, it shows the logo, and powers off. Full charge and nothing. I tried factory resetting the device. Not everyone knows how to factory reset a vr headset, neither would they be willing too if they are buying a basically brand new product. This is embarrassing. Certified by Oculus? I don't think so. Other than that the product is great, extremely minimal wear and tear sign. Disappointed that I had to go through the hassle of resetting the device. If this were truly inspected by Oculus, or now so called "Meta", then the device would be ready to go out of the packaging.

reviewTitle: Excelente producto pero le falta algo
reviewDescription: Es un buen producto, excelente diría yo pero es que al momento de jugar y quieres conectarlo a una PC ocupas un cable de al menos 5m para que puedas jugar tranquilo porque si tienes un internet muy malo no te va a servir de nada usar el Air link así que cuando compren sus oculus también compren un adaptador de 5m para que jueguen tranquilos y sin ningún problema

Me encanto realmente, es mi primera vez usando VR y desde hace 2 años que quería uno, es una experiencia asombrosa, en verdad lo recomiendo comprar, pero aun así revisen que no tenga ningún defecto ya que encontré un arañazo (leve) en el lente izquierdo :/
Está todo bien pero se me hizo extraño que llegara con una manchita café en la tela del visor y sin una correa

queria jugar haft life pero nesetitas computadora, entre otras cosas espere para acostumbrarme a los mareos que dan el producto, pero es imposible,  creo que los mareos son por las camaras que se mueven de arriba para bajo pero tu cuerpo no y eso causa que el cerebro se confunda.
El único defecto que encuentro es la falta títulos para jugar
Lo compre pero creo que le dura muyyyyy poco la batería
Bought two for my kids and after having a few months while charging they both stopped working.

reviewTitle: NOT CONNECTING TO WIFI even refurbished and now I cannot return it
reviewDescription: NOT CONNECTING TO WIFI even refurbished and now I cannot return it

Nothing but problems with this.  Right controller doesn't track properly.  Even spent the $110 on a new controller and having the same problem.  Meta customer support is absolutely useless.  Spent 45 minutes in chat, going in circles with model numbers and serial numbers and changing batteries, doing factory resets, and nothing worked.  Don't waste your money,  not worth buying.

reviewTitle: If you're going to buy this for PC VR, get ANY OTHER HEADSET.
reviewDescription: For standalone it's good for what it is- but the controllers degrade extremely quickly and paying for replacements is worth more then if you just bought any other better headset.Issues:-Within 4 months, stick drift. [aka the controller walks/moves for you at random]-Quest 2 FORCES you to sign up for a META account if you accidentally hit "Don't ask again." when asking to connect to PCs. There is LITERALLY no other way to change the option.-Forces you to sign up using MANDATORY debt card AND Meta account.-Battery life SIGNIFICANTLY decreases over time. In a less then a year of consistent use, the battery life will be less then two hours forcing you buy an extended battery pack.-Charging cable doesn't change as fast as the battery drains so for longer time you'd need to buy another accessory.I regret my purchase.

I got a chance to see how wonderful VR might be, but there were constant "SHELLENV keeps stopping" errors on my new toy. Looked up the error and followed the instructions; restarted it, did a factory reset, connected to the Sidekick app via otb that was supposed to clear the error according to interweb nerds, to no avail. Then chatted with Meta tech support, who didn't offer a fix, but only had me jump through hoops proving my purchase (4 serial numbers for each piece of equipment and the box) in order to send me a 12-day turnaround replacement.So, I am not sure how these "Renewed" items are being quality controlled (all it would take is to start it up and look at the screen), but I got a lemon this first time.Will update when the Amazon replacement gets here in 2 days. I was so excited.

reviewTitle: This caught fire at 2 am while charging
reviewDescription: My child loved this but it is unsafe and could have burnt down my house.

reviewTitle: We oreded two of these for my son and both did not work.
reviewDescription: The first one would never completely charge and the second one did not charge at all. So disappointing. It was for my son’s birthday present.

Okay so to start. We had a blast with it. We used the charger it came with and it never seemed to fully charge. So we bought a new charger for this specific one. The charger worked! But the downside is it got really hot while charging. So I kept and eye on it. Well last night my husband plugs it in to charge. When we woke up the charger was stuck to the headset and had melted.This is complete BS. Honestly, I am so upset. There obviously is something wrong with the headset because I bought the charger new. For the oculus quest 2 and now we can’t use the charger nor the oculus.Someone please get back to me on what the heck happened.

reviewTitle: Black screen in headset of this refurbished unit
reviewDescription: The set up instructions are not really clear outside the box. Once you find the set up section, it simply directs you to a website. When you go on the website, it sends you to the app. Once on the app, it asks to follow the instructions in the headset, starting with inputting a 5 digit code. Problem is my headset never moved past the Oculus logo, then it went black. The charging light on the side stayed on and there was no way to turn off the headset or reset since all of that is done through the menu on the headset. I googled why this happened and some thoughts were there was an update that some models did not take. I chatted with an Amazon rep who really didn't understand the product and simply said it seemed as if I had a defective unit and I should return for a refund. This purchase makes me very wary of purchasing refurbished equipment in the future.

These things are ridiculously too expensive for the quality of device you get. We're constantly having issues with the controllers and games loading. You should be ashamed of yourselves for making such an expensive paperweight.

reviewTitle: They are good and fun if you receive it in the mail
reviewDescription: Didn't receive it in the mail orderd a long time ago and haven't seen still mad about it

It will blink an SOS signal and doesn't connect.Meta Support takes forever to help with the problem, I just bought a new left controller. Probably gonna buy a brand new headset too. I love the Quest 2 and the experiences it brings. However I was disappointed with Amazon and its supplier because when the product arrived as it was labelled as Refurbished Product [see photo] but advertised as Renewed Premium which does not clearly indicate that the product is not new. The price paid was the same as Meta was advertising the same product [new] at the same time and Meta were providing the app "Beat Sabre" free with their product whereas the Amazon supplier did not provide this software included in the price. Both Amazon and Meta offered free shipping. The product was supplied with an American two pin plug and required the purchase of an adapter to allow it to be charged in Australia. The product has a 12 month warranty and because it took nearly 3 weeks to arrive from the US, I have decided to not attempt to return the product for a refund.

I've bought three Quests before and think they are awesome. Great VR headsets. This product was refurbished and it looked brand new when unboxing. We tried multiple times to get it to connect but it must have had a fault because it couldn't see the controllers or connect to the app on either iPad or Oppo so we had to return it. Looking forward to buying a replacement when the funds are returned.
Funciona bien, sin embargo a los 2 dias tuve un detalle con la conexión wifi que me costó mucho tiempo resolver, de plano tuve que volver a la restauracion de fabrica.
Creo los voy a regresar, nunca pude vincularlos aparte un mando no vincula solo uno prende y todo pero se queda parpareando, por último ni un día tienen!!!!!

As ordered

reviewTitle: I have bought games for other this was for me
reviewDescription: I have never liked video gamesI wanted to feel like I was in the game and nothing came closeUntil last week when I tried the game. With this game you are in the game it is all around you. Within 30 minutes of playing I ordered my game and about to buy one for my grandsons and my girlfriend. I was delivered two days ago and it is easy to learn and the graphics are very good you are in the game get one today.

Despite all the bad reviews- (which made me quite nervous about buying..) the product came factory reset, clean, nothing broken, and no pieces missing. I’ve been using it for about a month now with no problems at all (knock on wood!) and I’m hoping it stays that way. I love it so much, and it’s even more enjoyable because it no longer makes me feel motion sickness since now I’m used to it.Little reminders:-MAKE SURE THE LENSES AREN’T EXPOSED TO DIRECT SUNLIGHT!! I know it has a warning on the lenses, but most people overlook it/take off the stickers without reading.-Make sure to take frequent breaks and loosen the headset every now and then to avoid headaches!-Wipe the silicone piece (where your face rests in) down with a dry cloth between uses, so there’s no bacteria/sweat buildup.Happy gaming!
Brought this for my 7 year old and this thing is great for him. Remember to put your kids on time management though being as though it's directly on their eyes.
My grandson loved it, it was the only thing he wanted for Christmas . Plays it every day
Fast delivery they play with it daily
As a senior, was skeptical and had some fears using it, but I still prefer my my 100 inch projector and excited with some of the VR pics !!!! It can get expensive to buy apps !!!

Ordered the 256 GB version and it came packed in a box like new. New face cover, glasses extender, original charger and everything worked perfectly. Clean and looked new.Ordered to play with my son and we are having a blast in Dungeons of Eternity together. No issues with this headset at all.
Works awesome durable and easy to use.

Best gift i could ever receive!! Only concern is, i have a small head and its pretty heavy but what ill do is tie my hair up onto a ponytail or a bun and that keeps the headset from falling off my face. I may get a headache i may not but if anything ill get a new strap. Anyways this thing is absolutely awesome! Buy it!!

I am an old guy (nearing 60) exploring the VR world for the first time. The experience is incredible and so realistic. If this would have been around when I was a kid I probably would never have left the house either. Very easy to set up and use and great selection of games to play. I am not connected to my computer and my son tells me there is an even greater selection of games there. I prefer the sports games and playing as an NFL quarterback or a golfer on the pro courses are amazing. I have tried the roller coasters, fighter jets and working on the International Space Station and those games have created a queasy feeling which I have never experienced while in real events. It takes some getting use to, I am told.  I recommend this for anyone - I watched the kids 80-year-old grandmother play and have a blast while on it.

I bought the product and i am going to be extremely honest.So when i got the package, it is as it said, the packaging was extremely great, smelled brand new and had everything it said it should haveThe only problem literally was that the right controller was not working. I tried everything available at the time ti fix it, i did troubleshooting and even replaced the batteries and still didnt work, i contacted amazon and got it replaced, i will make a future update with the new device and hoping for the best.Btw the amazon customer service was insanely helpful, and for that reason i am not upset as much because he really went out of his way to help out. I will be updating you all with the new one i promiseUpdate july 28, 2022So as i promised i got my new product and as i said , the customer servce did help, i got the new oculus and i have been having it for a week and so far no problems and everything is great so i do recomment getting this product cause at the end if u have a problem, customer service is there for you

I got this for myself, and it is awesome. Its price is 30 dollars below average, and it came in perfect condition. It looks brand new, and it comes with all the supplies it needs. It came in on time also.  This is great for any age!!!
Good quality  bought for son

I bought this meta quest because I felt bored and fat...the more pounds I put on the less I wanted to exercise.  So NOW I am so crazy about playing Beat Saber!! You have to duck, dodge, and crouch while you slash at the objects coming towards you....all to the beat of awesome music.  I also have been able to see places in the world in VR that I would never be able to see in real life! There's tons of different apps you can buy from within the headset, with a lot of really cool games....I'm 61 and have a blast "shooting" the enemy in "Medal of Honor". I HIGHLY recommend meta quest 2 to any and everyone who wants a little more enjoyment out of life.  I also bought one for my grandson and he is wild about it...loves, loves it! If something ever happens to this one, I'm buying another immediately!!
He loves it but complains that all the younger kids are whooping his a*$ but we aren’t that old promise! 😂

reviewTitle: It’s nothing like I’ve ever seen before.
reviewDescription: My kids and I love this. It really gets us going ! Lol we love the game TOSS ! You should get it lol most definitely an adrenaline rusher lol I’ve gotten a lot of games and so far this has been the best game purchase I’ve done. It’s the 2nd game system I’ve bought. The first being the Nintendo switch.

This unit has worked perfectly with ZERO scratches or imperfections.  Family is having a blast with Beat Saber, Mini Golf, Population: One, and VR Poker.  You will definitely get some motion sickness with this if you are sensitive.  Even though the Avatars are more comic looking, it is real enough to freak your senses out.Be sure to put on the silicone cover over the foam that presses up against your face.  You will get sweaty on some games and nobody wants to share your sweat.  Also highly recommend getting the headset attachment with additional batteries.  Much better comfort than the strap that comes with it and the included batteries only last 2.5 hours.  For casting to a TV, don't recommend going through your phone.  Instead buy a ChromeCast and cast directly from headset to chromecast.  Latency is seriously reduced.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE my Oculus!  It has so many apps!  VR is a blast!  I just downloaded some fitness apps that make working out so much fun!  I am thrilled that I decided to go ahead and get one.  I did buy the refurbished one because I am a cheap a$$ and I know that I can trust Amazon with my purchases.  It came packaged as if it were new.  I went over it with a fine tooth and found no indication that it had even been used before.  Very pleased!  No issues.

reviewTitle: Too much fun! Everyone in the family will enjoy!
reviewDescription: Ordered this for my son’s birthday several months ago. Our first time having a VR device. This is so much fun and easy to use. We downloaded several games and found that the hardest thing is figuring out who is supposed to go next. There’s a lot of content available whether you want to game, enjoy virtual traveling, or whatever you feel like. The home location is customizable and you can even sit down with the headset on and watch Netflix or ESPN on a big screen in front of a fireplace (all virtual of course). We haven’t even begun to tap into the full potential of what it can do.

The problem might be more a software than a hardware problem but if you're the kind of person who likes endless loading screens this is for you, ive spent more time staring at dizzying sickening loading screens than I've spent with actual content, and that excludes when it just Starr flashing endlessly, have no desire to venture into VR again after this

Controllers come with terrible stick drift. headset has never been able to hold a charge for more than 30 mins i bought this for my friend and its already almost non playable it has so many issues like the screen came burnt with sun damage I WOULD RECCOMEND BUYING THIS FROM THE ACTUAL OCCULAS WEBSITE!!!

reviewTitle: Be aware that this product is refurbished!
reviewDescription: I really wanted to get into VR with this headset, I really do, but this product came messed up twice, first time, I got a faulty controller which couldn't connect and a broken charger. OBVIOUSLY I returned it in hopes of getting a new one that worked. But today I got the package opened up and tried to configure it but this time both my controllers wouldn't connect, which frustrates me because it was a complete waste of time, two whole weeks for both of my headset getting in poor conditions. I really want to make a good review of this item but I can't recommend it unless you except broken items.I hope that they start verifying that the items they refurbish actually works and don't throw us broken tech, really frustrating...

Got it on 28 Already filing a claim the  device will not will not pair reach out to Amazon was told I’ll be contact got  an email apologizing about the delivery delays and that i should wait till the 31. really how you go from the device is not working to not deliverTill  today I have not  heard from Amazon had to meta those guys were amazing but they could not get it to work so end up filing a manufacturer claim no thanks to Amazon feel I should get compensated for all the trouble I’m going threw but of course I’m fooling my self one thing is certain next time definitely not with Amazon these equipment are the same price so if you. cannot bring up the experience what’s  the point getting it from you

Do not buy from these people! They re-sell refurbished Oculus's that only work for about two weeks before the left controller simply dies and cannot be fixed with every troubleshooting method in the book! They're a sham selling damaged goods and should be put out of business!!!

reviewTitle: Complete P O S - did not work
reviewDescription: Opened it and was excited to use it.  It required an immediate update of software.  Worked fine until then.  Directly after software update - no screen. Only music.  Complete waste of money, time and excitement.  Would NOT recommend. Now I have to spend all my time troubleshooting and fixing a broke *** POS that I just purchased.  Annoyed.

The description does not directly tell you this is a refurbished model, it is.  Badly (mine at least).  I've included a side by side photo of the same model but new from Oculus and you can see that the new model comes with a soft rubber face lining for easy cleaning.  The refurbished is just foam (it'll absorb sweat and you can't clean it, this will quickly ruin the lining and have to be replaced).  Returning these things are a massive pain and the price drop is only slightly less than just buying a new one from a proper store.  Strongly recommend going elsewhere for this.
